content.title: Scheme of Encouragement to Young Artists
content.department: Tamil Nadu Eyal Isai Nataka Mandram
content.beneficiary: Young artistes proficient in Carnatic style
content.details: The scheme offers remuneration for various art programs, ranging from ₹5,000 to ₹10,000, depending on the type of program.
benefits: Opportunity to perform in various disciplines
eligibility: Young artistes proficient in Carnatic style
Music artists above 16 years and within 30 years
Bharathanatyam artistes above 15 years and within 30 years
exclusions: Non-residents of Tamil Nadu are not eligible
content.application_process: Eligible young artistes can apply by obtaining the application from the Tamil Nadu Eyal Isai Nataka Mandram after the release of advertisements in newspapers.

faqs.question: Who implements the scheme in Tamil Nadu?
faqs.answer: The scheme is implemented by the Tamil Nadu Eyal Isai Nataka Mandram.

faqs.question: How is the selection process carried out for the scheme?
faqs.answer: The selection of eligible artistes is done through an audition test conducted by an Expert Committee.

faqs.question: Where should applications for the scheme be sent?
faqs.answer: Applications for the scheme should be sent to the Member-Secretary, Tamil Nadu Eyal Isai Nataka Manram, at the provided address.

faqs.question: How many young artistes have benefited from the scheme so far?
faqs.answer: So far, 1993 young artistes have benefited from the scheme.

faqs.question: Can an artist already selected in one discipline apply for another?
faqs.answer: Yes, an artist selected in one discipline can apply for another discipline under the scheme.

faqs.question: What happens if an artiste fails the audition test?
faqs.answer: If an artiste fails the audition test, they may not be selected to benefit from the scheme.

faqs.question: How often are auditions conducted for the scheme?
faqs.answer: Auditions for the scheme are conducted as per the schedule decided by the Expert Committee.
